Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BTD-1 (Baboon theta-defensin-1; also PhTD1, PhTD-1, P. hamadryas theta-defensin-1; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S, XXC; UCBB1aB; Cys-rich; Arg-rich; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: Olive baboon,Papio anubis, and blood leukocytes, Hamadryas baboon,Papio hamadryas

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Isolated from baboon leukocytes.Also discovered in a different Baboo (Stegemann et al., 2010). Found in multiple species.Activity: Diffusion assays indicates activity agsainst E. coli ML35, S. aureus 502a, and C. albicans 16820. Active against drug resistant C. albicans clinical isolates (MIC 6.2-25 ug/ml) (Basso et al., 2018).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: It disrupts E. coli membranes.Updated 5/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Garcia AE, Osapay G, Tran PA, Yuan J, Selsted ME.2008
Literature Information.Title: Isolation, synthesis, and antimicrobial activities of naturally occurring theta-defensin isoforms from baboon leukocytes.
